creator: jorepe@bol.com.br
text:
Hi all,
I have a problem on working with FOP. I need a XML file with
6000 lines and when I made a XLST transformation to PDF, the process
get stoped and I got the following message "out of memory".
I would like to know if FOP process a XML file with 6000 or more?
When I run the process, in the browser, I´ve gotten this message:
Warning table-layout = auto is not supported, using fixed!
and 
Sum of Fixed column widths xxxx greather than maximum specified IPD 311811

Anyone?

Best Regards
José Renato Pequeno

creator: neilg@ca.ibm.com
text:
Knowing the size of the file in terms of bytes rather than lines would be 
helpful, but under the assumption that lines aren't insanely long Xerces's DOM 
should easily be able to handle a file of this size on a machine with a 
reasonable amount of memory.  So, if there's a problem here, hopefully the FOP 
project will have some insight about what to do.

The xml file size is 3.839KB. I have a Pentium III with 512MB memory and when I 
start the process I use java -Xms300m -Xmx512m.
Thanks!
creator: jorepe@bol.com.br
j3322ptm@yahoo.de
